content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    offset = 1
    while offset <= length(str)
        # determine the end position of the current line
        index = offset + (text_width - 1)
        while index < length(str)
            if isletter(str[index])
                # if the next character is a letter,
                # then advance the index to the next whitespace character
                index += 1
                offset += 1
                continue
            else
                # if the next character is not a letter,
                # then break out of the loop
                break
            end
        end
        push!(lines, str[offset:index])
        offset = index + 1
    end
    return lines
end
```

Example:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Mauris ut ornare quam, in tempus purus. Vestibulum in urna vitae metus vestibulum tempus. ", 10)
["Lorem", "ipsum", "dolor", "sit amet,", "consectetur", "adipiscing", "elit.", "Mauris ut", "ornare", "quam, in", "tempus", "purus.", "Vestibulum", "in urna", "vitae", "metus", "vestibulum", "tempus."]
```
